author: Staff Reporter
text:
Arts and Crafts village developed by the Puducherry Tourism Development Corporation (PTDC) at Murungapakkam near here is likely to be inaugurated in two weeks.

The village built at a cost of Rs. 5.32 crore was conceived to showcase the works of artisans all over the country.

From here, artisans will produce, display and sell art and handicraft items.

Handicrafts from various states like terracotta, Thanjavur paintings, antiques, studio pottery and hand made goods will be presented in the village. It will be a permanent facility functioning round the year.

Tourism Minister P. Rajavelu accompanied by Secretary to Tourism Mihir Vardhan and senior officials on Saturday inspected the progress of works at the Arts and Crafts village.

Mr. Rajavelu also inspected the Chunnambar boat house and Paradise Beach.

Tourism Minister

P. Rajavelu inspected the progress of the works on Saturday
title: Arts and Crafts village to open around Pongal time
